name: Chase E-Xact Payment Gateway For WooCommerce
author: Ishan Verma / Kermit Woodall

sections.description:
Chase E-Xact Payment Gateway for WooCommerce

makes your website ready to use Chase E-Xact payment gateway to accept credit/debit cards on your ecommerce store in safe way.

E-xact Transactions has been delivering on merchant satisfaction for over 10 years – and they’re not done yet. Where there’s a need for fast, protected transaction processing and easy answers they make it happen.

WooCommerce 2.1.1 Compatible

Features

Few features of this plugin:

  1. No SSL required

  2. No PCI required

  3. Easy to install and configure

  4. Option to configure success & failure message

  5. Safe way to process credit cards and debit cards on WooCommerce using Chase E-Xact/Authorize.net SIM

  6. This plugin use hosted solution provided by Chase E-Xact and payment is processed on secured servers of Chase E-Xact

Arbitrary section
sections.installation:
Easy steps to install the plugin:

  1. Upload e-xact-payment-gateway-for-woocommerce folder/directory to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory

  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.

  3. Go to WooCommerce => Settings

  4. On the “Settings” page, select “Payment Gateways” tab.

  5. Under “Payment Gateways” you will find all the available gateways, select “Authorize.net” option

  6. On this page you wil find option to configure the plugin for use with WooCommerce

  7. Enter the API details (Login ID, Transaction Key)

  8. Configurable elements:

Title: This will appear on checkout page as name for this payment gateway

Description: This will appear on checkout page as description for this payment gateway

Login ID: This is the Login ID provided by Chase E-Xact. (Note: this not your User login ID for Merchant Account)

Transaction Key: This is Transaction Key provided by Chase E-Xact

Transaction Success Message: This message will appear upon successful transaction. You can customize this message as per your need.

Transaction Failed Message: This message will appear when transaction will get failed/declined at payment gateway.

API Mode: This option sets the mode of API. Test/Sandbox Mode is when you need to test the gateway using some test transations. Live Mode to be used to process real transaction and card will actually get charged for this.
sections.faq:
Is SSL Required to use this plugin?

SSL is not required but is often recommended.

short_description: This Payment Gateway For WooCommerce extends the functionality of WooCommerce to accept payments from credit/debit cards using Chase E-Xact Gateway
